DOC.brief_summary: This study conduct show indomethacin least effective ketorolac prevention ocular inflammation follow cataract surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Indomethacin Eyedrops Compared With Ketorolac Eyedrops Ocular Inflammation Following Cataract Surgery
DOC.criteria: Subjects must plan undergo cataract surgery one eye phacoemulsification posterior chamber intraocular lens , use topical general anaesthesia . Subjects must preoperative flare â‰¤ 15 ph/ms , measure laser flare meter ( LFM ) without pharmacological pupil dilation , within 2 month preoperatively . Subjects progressive pathology require use topical systemic antiinflammatory antiinfectious agent . Subjects take acetylsalicylic acid dose > 100 mg daily discontinue usage study . Subjects history asthma link acetylsalicylic acid nonsteroidal antiinflammatory ( NSAI ) drug administration . Subjects immunodepression . Subjects history intolerance study drug NSAI drug . Subjects monocular reason cataract . Subjects treat local systemic antiinflammatory drug within 10 day prior inclusion .
